Applications of AI Security and Surveillance



AI is used very broadly in the field of security; however, there is one particular usage of AI that stands out among the rest: facial recognition software. These programs are varied in their usesâ€”some just recognize faces in general, while others bookmark moments when faces appear in long security tapes so humans only have to look through a few minutes of footage for perpetrators of a crime instead of multiple hours or even days. This allows investigators to divert their attention to other, more pressing matters.

AI facial recognition software is merely an umbrella term for a huge field of security, but here, importantly, surveillance. One particular part of that field that we believe all people should know about is biometrics. Biometrics is the use of unique physical characteristics (like a face or fingerprints) to verify your identity, basically letting you have a very complex personal passkey with you at all times. Many companies are opting to use these instead of short passkeys, like with Apple's Face ID and how many banking apps let you substitute a facial scan for your PIN.

While this application of AI is widely seen as beneficial for its innovation and ease of use, there is a dark side. In many cases, companies use this software to secretly breach your privacy and steal your facial data or pictures of your face for training future AIs. On top of that, many people see this as "the end of anonymity" if governments get their hands on this data and use these systems, because no matter what you are doing, as long as they get a picture of you, they can identify you instantly, immediately revoking any privacy you thought you had.

In conclusion, the use of AI in security and surveillance is among the most important applications of the technology. This is because it can be used for comfort and quality-of-life improvements, but it can also be used maliciously to track people via their biometric data and learn all their information. AI is a very important technology that will change the world whether we like it or not. With all that information, you can now go back to Security & Surveillance or go to our About Us Page.
